prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'It seems like Light Years ago'

responses.text:
It seems like Light Years ago, a whisper in the void,
When laughter echoed, joy unalloyed.
Now silence reigns, a cosmic, chilling hush,
And memories, like stardust, softly rush.
Each moment then, a galaxy so bright,
Illuminating every day and night.
But distance stretches, vast and undefined,
Leaving only echoes of what we left behind.
The warmth of touch, a glance, a shared embrace,
Lost in the depths of time and endless space.
I search the stars, for signs of what once was,
A fading nebula, defying all the laws
Of presence, closeness, comfort, and of grace.
Just a faint image, on time's weary face.
And though I strive to bridge the chasm wide,
That ancient light has long since truly died.

It seems like Light Years ago, the world was fresh and new,
With vibrant hues of morning, kissed by gentle dew.
Each day a grand adventure, a story yet untold,
Before the weight of seasons made the spirit old.
The dreams we spun like gossamer, so fragile and so grand,
Were held within the hollow of a hopeful, open hand.
Now dust motes dance in sunbeams, through windows etched with age,
And every turning calendar adds another weary page.
The path once clear and shining, now overgrown with doubt,
And youthful fire, once so fierce, has slowly flickered out.
Oh, for a cosmic rewind, a journey back through time,
To feel that pure exhilaration, in its innocent prime.
But time's a relentless current, pulling ever on,
And what was once so present, is now forever gone.

It seems like Light Years ago, we stood beneath the moon,
And swore our endless futures, to a whispered, silver tune.
The promises we etched in air, with breath so warm and light,
Now feel like ancient hieroglyphs, lost to the endless night.
That youthful fervor, burning bright, a supernova's gleam,
Has cooled to cosmic background, a half-forgotten dream.
I trace the constellations, that once bore witness true,
But even their eternal gaze, offers no solace new.
The path diverged, a stellar drift, across the cosmic sea,
Leaving only echoes of what used to be.
The gravity of absence, a pull so strong and deep,
While memories, like distant stars, their silent vigil keep.
And though I reach across the void, with longing in my heart,
That radiant connection, has been torn so far apart.

It seems like Light Years ago, the laughter filled the air,
And every single moment, banished all despair.
The world was painted vibrant, with colors bold and bright,
And worries were but shadows, banished by the light.
Now shadows stretch unending, across a barren plain,
And quiet contemplation, replaces joy and pain.
The tapestry of moments, so intricately spun,
Has unraveled slowly, beneath a distant sun.
I try to grasp the threads again, to mend what's come undone,
But time's relentless current, leaves me with none.
Just ghostly echoes lingering, where vibrant life once played,
A silent, empty theater, where memories have strayed.
Oh, for a fleeting glimpse again, of that forgotten grace,
But time's cruel hand has wiped away, each cherished, smiling face.

It seems like Light Years ago, the future stretched so wide,
An open, boundless landscape, where dreams could safely hide.
Each aspiration, a nascent star, ready to ignite,
And every bold endeavor, bathed in hopeful, morning light.
Now horizons have receded, the landscape's cold and grey,
And youthful aspirations, have slowly slipped away.
The paths once clear and promising, now twist and turn and fade,
And all the grand ambitions, have been subtly betrayed.
I search for that bright vision, that once held me enthralled,
But find only the remnants, of a future uninstalled.
The cosmic dust of disappointment, settles on the soul,
Taking its heavy toll.
And though I strive for new beginnings, to rekindle what was lost,
The weight of what has vanished, comes at a heavy cost.

It seems like Light Years ago, the world was full of song,
And every note a promise, where we truly did belong.
The melodies of friendship, the harmonies of love,
Resounded through the heavens, sent from realms above.
Now silence is the chorus, a stark and empty sound,
As if all vibrant music, has left this hallowed ground.
The instruments are broken, the voices soft and low,
And only faint refrains remain, of tunes we used to know.
I strain my ears to listen, for a familiar, gentle strain,
But find only the echo, of a sweet, forgotten pain.
The rhythm of our shared existence, once so strong and clear,

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'I had eight birds hatched in one nest,'

responses.text:
I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A tiny world, a feathered quest.
Each beak a-gape, a hungry cry,
Beneath the vast and watchful sky.
My heart, a mother's, swelled with pride,
As fledgling dreams began to glide.
From fragile shells, a vibrant throng,
Their chirping chorus, sweet and strong.
They learned to flutter, then to soar,
Exploring skies, and wanting more.
Though time would call them far and wide,
Their memory in my heart would bide.
Eight little souls, a fleeting grace,
Who left their mark upon this place.
A fleeting season, warm and bright,
Then silence fell with fading light.
But in my mind, the echoes stay,
Of eight small birds, and yesterday.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A bustling haven, put to the test.
Each morning brought a joyous din,
As tiny voices ushered in
The sun's first rays, a golden gleam,
Awakening a vibrant dream.
From downy fluff to feathered flight,
They filled my days with pure delight.
I watched them preen, and stretch, and grow,
Their instincts guiding where to go.
The strongest wings, the boldest heart,
Each played a crucial, vital part.
Though separation's pangs would start,
And tear their little world apart,
I knew the wild would call their name,
And freedom fan their inner flame.
Eight precious lives, a fleeting art,
Forever etched within my heart.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A tender brood, by love caressed.
The twigs and moss, a cozy bed,
Where tiny, hopeful futures spread.
Each speckled egg, a promise kept,
While silent, watchful vigil crept.
Then cracks appeared, a wondrous sight,
And life emerged, bathed in soft light.
Eight hungry mouths, a constant plea,
For worms and grubs, for you and me.
Their fledgling feathers, soft and new,
Reflected skies of azure blue.
I taught them songs, and whispered low,
The secrets that all wild things know.
And when they left, a bittersweet farewell,
A story only time can tell.
Of eight small wonders, brave and free,
Who flew away, from you and me.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A symphony of life, expressed.
From fragile forms, a vibrant hue,
As morning dew gave way to new
Adventures waiting, just beyond
The leafy branches, green and fond.
Their tiny hearts, a rapid beat,
As growing wings prepared their feet
For journeys vast, and skies unknown,
Where seeds of courage would be sown.
I fed them dreams, and whispered hope,
To help them navigate and cope
With trials faced, and dangers near,
Dispelling every nascent fear.
Eight spirits bright, a joyful throng,
Who sang their sweet, departing song.
And though they're gone, their spirit stays,
In sunlit memories of those days.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
Each chirping soul, a welcome guest.
Beneath the eaves, a sheltered home,
Where tiny futures learned to roam.
From dawn's first blush to twilight's gleam,
They lived a vibrant, feathered dream.
Their eager pecks, a gentle plea,
For sustenance, for liberty.
I watched them test their fragile might,
Against the wind, in fading light.
Each flutter, hop, a step so small,
Towards the freedom of the call
Of distant lands, and open air,
Beyond the nest, beyond all care.
Eight precious lives, a fleeting art,
Who left their mark upon my heart.
And though they flew, to find their way,
Their youthful echoes softly play.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A bustling, vibrant, feathered crest.
Each tiny eye, a curious gleam,
Reflecting life's unfolding dream.
The world outside, a mystery grand,
Beyond the safety of my hand.
I offered warmth, and gentle care,
And whispered hopes into the air.
They learned to trust, to take their flight,
Towards the sun, so strong and bright.
Their calls, a chorus, wild and free,
An untamed, joyous melody.
Though bittersweet, their swift goodbyes,
Reflected in their soaring skies.
Eight feathered jewels, a precious few,
Whose memory forever's new.
They taught me lessons, deep and true,
Of letting go, and seeing through.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A miracle, put to the test.
From fragile shells, a life anew,
Reflecting skies of morning blue.
Each tiny form, a perfect grace,
Finding its rhythm, finding its place.
Their hungry cries, a constant sound,
As life's first lessons spun around.
I watched them grow, with tender eye,
Beneath the boughs, where breezes sigh.
Their wings unfurled, a silent plea,
For independence, wild and free.
Though sadness touched my heart that day,
When one by one, they flew away.
Eight feathered blessings, swift and keen,
Forever etched within the scene.
Of simple joys, and dreams untold,
A story precious, brave, and bold.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,
A tiny kingdom, truly blessed.
Each downy head, a sleepy nod,
Communing with the silent God
Of nature's rhythm, pure and deep,
While secrets of the wild they'd keep.
I saw their courage, small yet grand,
As they prepared to leave my hand.
Their chirps, a language understood,
Of hunger, warmth, and brotherhood.
They learned to peck, to stretch, to preen,
Against the backdrop of the green.
And when the time for flight arrived,
Their youthful spirit truly thrived.
Eight winged wonders, taking hold,
Of futures waiting to unfold.
Though empty now, the nest remains,
A testament to sun and rains.

I had eight birds hatched in one nest,

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'It snowed and snowed ,the whole world over,'

responses.text:
It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
A silent hush, a soft white cover.
From mountain peak to valley deep,
The earth beneath began to sleep.
Each city gleamed, a frosted gem,
As winter's breath embraced them.
The ancient forests, stark and tall,
Caught crystal flakes, a gentle fall.
The deserts, too, in stark surprise,
Reflected light from leaden skies.
No corner spared, no land unkissed,
By nature's pure, ethereal mist.
And every soul, in quiet awe,
Observed this universal law:
That beauty, stark and cold and grand,
Could unify each distant land.
A fleeting magic, pure and deep,
While weary mortals softly sleep.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
A blanket spun, a winter's clover.
The rooftops wore a sugar glaze,
Lost in the soft, enchanting haze.
From arctic wastes to tropic shores,
It whispered through a thousand doors.
The jungle canopy, so green,
Was dusted white, a novel scene.
Children peered with wide-eyed gaze,
Through frosted panes, in snowy maze.
The old folk sighed, a knowing glance,
At nature's slow, unhurried dance.
The highways blurred, the pathways hid,
Beneath the flakes, a world forbid.
But in that hush, a peace descended,
As every earthly sorrow ended,
For just a spell, a tranquil dream,
A universal, frozen stream.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
Beneath a sky, a silver rover.
The gentle flakes, a steady stream,
Fulfilled a universal dream.
From bustling port to quiet farm,
Protected now from every harm.
The weary traveler, slow and cold,
Watched stories in the flakes unfold.
The wild beasts sought their sheltered den,
And waited for the thaw again.
The ocean waves, a foamy white,
Reflected back the softest light.
And every heart, in every place,
Felt wonder in this snowy space.
A pause, a breath, a sacred spell,
Where silent beauty cast its swell.
A world transformed, serene and deep,
While hidden secrets softly sleep.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
A pristine veil, a soft white cover.
The ancient stones, the modern glass,
Were cloaked in white, as moments pass.
From sun-drenched plains to rainy coasts,
It joined the silent, spectral hosts.
The bustling markets, now so still,
Felt winter's quiet, icy chill.
The mountain peaks, already grand,
Were giants in a frosted land.
The rivers slowed, a glassy sheet,
Reflecting back the falling sleet.
And every soul, in silent prayer,
Breathed in the cold, crisp winter air.
A unity, a shared delight,
In nature's universal might.
A world reborn, in pure design,
A cosmic, crystalline divine.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
Like scattered pearls, a winter's lover.
The fields lay hushed, the trees stood bare,
Embracing winter's silent prayer.
From desert sands to icy floes,
The gentle, drifting white arose.
The city lights, a blurry gleam,
Reflected in a frozen dream.
The distant hills, a softened line,
Became a masterpiece, divine.
The tiny birds, in huddled groups,
Endured the storm in silent droops.
And every hearth, a warmer glow,
As outside, flakes continued so.
A quiet grace, a tranquil scene,
Where every worry felt unseen.
A world submerged, in softest white,
A canvas pure, for morning's light.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
A whispered secret, a silent rover.
The busy streets, a muffled sound,
As flakes descended to the ground.
From northern lights to southern stars,
It broke through all of human bars.
The mighty rivers, wide and grand,
Were silver threads across the land.
The smallest flower, hid from view,
Beneath a blanket, fresh and new.
The lonely traveler, far from home,
Watched winter's beauty softly roam.
And every mind, in quiet thought,
By nature's gentle hand was caught.
A fleeting moment, calm and deep,
While weary, troubled spirits sleep.
A universal, soft embrace,
Upon the earth's expansive face.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
A hush descended, like a cover.
The vibrant hues of summer's past,
Were hidden now, designed to last.
From busy docks to quiet lanes,
It washed away all earthly stains.
The ancient ruins, standing proud,
Were cloaked in winter's silent shroud.
The sleepy villages, serene,
Became a picture, pure and clean.
The distant oceans, cold and grey,
Reflected back the fading day.
And every heart, in every place,
Felt winter's cool, ethereal grace.
A moment held, in icy gleam,
A universal, tranquil dream.
A world transformed, a pure delight,
Bathed in the soft, ethereal light.

It snowed and snowed, the whole world over,
A gentle blessing, a winter's lover.

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'Just a few dwindling pools remain'

responses.text:
Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Where once a river, wide and deep, did flow.
Now cracked earth aches beneath the sun's harsh reign,
A silent testament to what we know.
The fish, once vibrant, now lie still and dry,
Their scales reflecting stories of despair.
The birds, in frantic circles, wheel and cry,
For sustenance that simply isn't there.
Each shrinking puddle holds a fragile gleam,
A mirror to a sky that offers naught.
A whispered echo of a forgotten dream,
A battle lost, a lesson dearly bought.
And in their depths, a fading, weary plea,
For rain to fall, for life to bloom anew,
Before these last, sad vestiges agree,
To vanish wholly, leaving only dew
Of memory, upon a barren plain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Reflecting skies of weary grey.
Where laughter echoed, free from pain,
Now silence holds its somber sway.
The once-bright lilies, bent and brown,
Their vibrant petals, long since shed.
The gentle current, slowing down,
Where dragonflies once softly sped.
Each shrinking circle, ever less,
A testament to time's harsh hand.
A silent, desolate caress,
Upon this parched and thirsting land.
And in their depths, a history sleeps,
Of seasons past, of vibrant green.
While nature quietly weeps,
For all that was, and might have been.
A poignant truth, etched in the strain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Like scattered jewels on desert sand.
Each holding secrets, whispered, plain,
Of life's tenacious, fragile stand.
The sun beats down, relentless, fierce,
Evaporating hope and grace.
And through the heat, the heart still pierces,
The memory of a wetter place.
The frogs, once croaking, loud and bold,
Now huddle close, in silent fear.
A story in each drop untold,
As drought's cold shadow lingers near.
And as they shrink, a bitter sigh,
Escapes the dry and dusty air.
A final, desperate, whispered cry,
A burden that no one can bear.
Against the odds, through sun and rain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Where once the children splashed and played.
Now muddy edges, etched with pain,
Reflect the promises betrayed.
The vibrant moss, a fading green,
Clings to the rocks with fragile hold.
A desolate and somber scene,
A story waiting to unfold.
Each shrinking space, a silent plea,
For waters fresh, for life's return.
A stark and stark reality,
A lesson we are slow to learn.
And in their depths, a quiet plea,
For mercy from the burning sun.
Before they cease entirely,
Before the final race is run.
Beneath the sky, a mournful stain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Like tears upon a parched, dry cheek.
A testament to nature's strain,
A future that feels bleak and weak.
The reeds stand brittle, tall and stark,
Their vibrant color, long since gone.
Each fading shadow leaves its mark,
As day gives way to weary dawn.
And in their mirror, clouds drift by,
Unburdened, offering no relief.
A silent, universal sigh,
A profound and overwhelming grief.
And as they shrink, a silent chime,
Of moments lost, of what once was.
Consumed by unrelenting time,
Obeying nature's cruelest laws.
Through dusty wind and gentle rain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Each holding light, a precious gleam.
Against the tide, against the pain,
A fragile, captivating dream.
The smooth, round stones, now fully bare,
Once hidden deep beneath the flow.
Now bake beneath the scorching air,
Where only dust and shadows grow.
And in their depths, a quiet hum,
Of life that struggles to survive.
Until the longed-for rains will come,
To keep the fading hope alive.
They cling to life, with silent grace,
These remnants of a grander past.
A fading smile upon earth's face,
A memory that's meant to last.
Though drought may rage and sun may drain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Like scattered memories, faint and old.
Whispering stories of the rain,
In silver depths, bravely unfold.
The thirsty ground, it cracks and yearns,
For solace from the fiery sky.
As every living creature learns,
To watch the precious waters dry.
Each shrinking circle, small and bright,
A final stand, a desperate fight.
Against the fading of the light,
Against the coming of the night.
And in their depths, a silent plea,
For solace from the scorching heat.
To set their captive spirits free,
Before their final, sad defeat.
Through summer's heat and winter's pain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Where minnows darted, swift and free.
Now slow and sluggish, feel the strain,
Of what their future's meant to be.
The lily pads, a faded green,
Now curl and crisp beneath the sun.
A desolate and somber scene,
A battle that is almost won.
By drought's embrace, relentless, deep,
It steals the life, it takes its toll.
While weary nature tries to keep,
Its fragile, fading, weary soul.
And in their depths, a silent dread,
Of what tomorrow's light may bring.
As all the vibrant life has fled,
No birds upon the branches sing.
Through parched earth's sorrow, and its pain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Like ancient tears on desert stone.
Each holding secrets, clear and plain,
Of life that struggles, all alone.
The thirsty air, it sighs and moans,
As winds whip dust across the land.
The earth beneath, it cracks and groans,
A desolate and barren sand.
And in their depths, a silent prayer,
For clouds to gather, dark and vast.
To bring relief, to soothe despair,
Before the final moments pass.
They cling to life, with fragile might,
These remnants of a wetter age.
A fading spark, a dying light,
Upon a scorched and empty stage.
Though hope may fade, and dreams may wane,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

Just a few dwindling pools remain,
Reflecting shadows, long and lean.
Where once a vibrant, verdant plain,
Now only dust and death are seen.
The willow's branches, bent and low,
No longer dip into the stream.
They watch the precious waters go,
Like fragments of a fading dream.
And in their depths, a quiet plea,
For respite from the burning sun.
For what will become of thee,
When all the precious drops are run?
They hold their breath, with silent grace,
These remnants of a vibrant past.
A fading smile upon earth's face,
A memory that's meant to last.
Through summer's heat and winter's pain,
Just a few dwindling pools remain.

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'When I am happy,'

responses.text:
When I am happy, the world takes on a vibrant hue,
The sky a deeper azure, the grass a richer green.
My heart, a hummingbird, flits through the day anew,
Each breath a melody, a joyful, whispered scene.
The worries that once clung, like shadows in the night,
Recede to distant corners, forgotten and unseen.
A lightness fills my steps, a radiating light,
As if the very air itself has been made clean.
I see the good in all, the beauty in the small,
A child's infectious laughter, a blossom in the rain.
And from my spirit's core, I answer freedom's call,
No longer bound by sorrow, no longer held by pain.
When I am happy, truly, deeply, purely so,
The universe conspires to make my spirit glow.

When I am happy, a gentle breeze does blow,
Through tangled thoughts and doubts that often bind.
My spirit lifts, a seed begins to grow,
Leaving all anxious worries far behind.
The sunbeams dance upon my kitchen floor,
Each mundane task a rhythm, soft and sweet.
I hum a tune I've never heard before,
And find a quiet solace in my feet.
My eyes perceive the world with fresh delight,
A robin's song, a cloud in endless blue.
And every moment, bathed in golden light,
Feels like a promise, wonderfully new.
When I am happy, simple joys take flight,
And paint my inner landscape, pure and bright.

When I am happy, the world transforms its face,
From monochrome to colors bold and deep.
A smile springs forth, erasing every trace
Of burdens that my weary soul would keep.
My voice finds strength, a clear and ringing sound,
To share the joy that bubbles from within.
No longer tethered to the solid ground,
My thoughts like birds, on airy wings begin
To soar above the mundane and the gray,
To seek the sun, to dance among the stars.
The shadows flee, and welcome is the day,
Healing the old and long-forgotten scars.
When I am happy, life's a gentle art,
A masterpiece created by my heart.

When I am happy, silence sings a tune,
More eloquent than any spoken word.
The quiet peace beneath the silver moon,
Or morning chirps from some awakened bird.
My mind, a calm and clear reflective pool,
Receives the world without a ripple's sign.
I feel content, no need to play the fool,
Just basking in this peaceful state of mine.
The past recedes, the future holds no dread,
Just this sweet moment, perfect and complete.
Each thought a blessing, gently softly bred,
A tranquil rhythm, wonderfully sweet.
When I am happy, truly, deeply blessed,
My soul finds solace, finally at rest.

When I am happy, laughter freely flows,
A cascade of pure joy, unbidden, bright.
It banishes the worries that arose,
And fills my being with a radiant light.
The air feels crisp, a vibrant, living thing,
Each breath a gift, a promise of new cheer.
My spirit soars on an invisible wing,
Dispelling every doubt, erasing fear.
The world becomes a stage, where beauty plays,
A symphony of colors, sounds, and grace.
And in this glow, through all my fleeting days,
I find my true and most authentic place.
When I am happy, everything aligns,
And life unfolds in exquisite designs.

When I am happy, shadows take their leave,
And sunlight streams through every open pane.
My anxious thoughts no longer interweave,
But dissipate like mist before the rain.
My heart expands, a spacious, welcoming room,
For kindness, empathy, and gentle grace.
No hint of sorrow, no impending gloom,
Just pure contentment shining on my face.
The mundane tasks become a joyful dance,
Each step a rhythm, light and unconfined.
I seize each moment, given a fresh chance,
To leave the weary, troubled past behind.
When I am happy, truly, deeply free,
The world reflects the inner peace I see.

When I am happy, colors seem more bold,
The crimson sunset, or the ocean's blue.
Each story in the world begins to unfold,
With wonder and a perspective fresh and new.
The smallest details capture my delight,
A spider's web, a dewdrop on a leaf.
My soul is bathed in an ethereal light,
Bringing my troubled spirit sweet relief.
I feel connected, part of something vast,
A cosmic dance, a universal hum.
The worries that once held me firmly fast,
Are overcome, their power overcome.
When I am happy, truly, deeply keen,
Life is a vibrant, captivating scene.

When I am happy, music fills the air,
A silent melody that only I can hear.
It banishes the burdens and the care,
And makes each moment wonderfully clear.
The world outside, a canvas bright and wide,
Reflects the joy that blossoms in my soul.
With every breath, a sense of inner pride,
Making my fractured spirit feel whole.
I see the beauty in the common things,
The way the light falls, or a child's soft sigh.
My heart takes flight, on eager, hopeful wings,
Beneath a vast and never-ending sky.
When I am happy, truly, deeply blessed,
My inner world is perfectly at rest.

When I am happy, burdens feel so light,
Like feathers drifting on a gentle breeze.
The world is bathed in an ethereal light,
And every thought my troubled spirit frees.
My steps are buoyant, skipping on the ground,
Each moment filled with purpose and with grace.
No trace of sorrow can be ever found,
Just pure contentment shining on my face.
The air I breathe is sweeter, crisp, and clean,
As if a magic spell has been cast round.
And every sight, a captivating scene,
Where peace and inner harmony are found.
When I am happy, truly, deeply bright,
My very being overflows with light.

When I am happy, words flow from my pen,
Like sparkling streams that tumble down a hill.
Each verse a truth, revealed again, again,
My mind at peace, my restless spirit still.
The world outside, a vibrant, living dream,
Reflects the joy that radiates from me.
And every thought, a pure and silver gleam,
Of understanding, wild and wonderfully free.
I find the beauty in the smallest things,
A whispered secret, or a gentle touch.
My soul takes flight, on eager, hopeful wings,
And finds a solace that I love so much.
When I am happy, truly, deeply so,
The seeds of creativity start to grow.

When I am happy, worries lose their sting,
And fade away like mist before the sun.
My heart takes flight, on an ethereal wing,
Each battle fought, each victory hard-won.
The air is sweet, a fragrant, gentle breeze,
That whispers secrets through the rustling trees.
I feel connected, wonderfully at ease,
My spirit soaring, finding inner peace.
Each moment lived, a treasure to behold,
A precious gem, a story to unfold.
The future bright, no longer dark and cold,
But filled with promise, brave and strong and bold.
When I am happy, truly, deeply free,
The world becomes a symphony for me.

When I am happy, colors seem to dance,
And every sound becomes a sweet refrain.
I view the world through an enchanted glance,
Forgetting all the sorrow and the pain.
The sunbeams play upon my kitchen floor,
Each dust motes glinting, tiny stars of light.
And from my heart, I open up the door,

No longer bound by shadows of the past,
My spirit soars, untethered and so free.
This feeling, pure and wonderful, will last,

When I am happy, truly, deeply bright,

When I am happy, time itself expands,
Each second lingers, precious and profound.
I feel the earth beneath my eager hands,

The air I breathe is crisp and sweet and clean,

My soul is bathed in an ethereal light,

Beneath a vast and never-ending sky.

My steps are light, a dancer on the breeze,

I find a quiet comfort and an ease,

The air I breathe is sweeter, crisp, and clean,

Where peace and inner harmony are found.

Each verse a truth, where I truly belong,

The world outside, a vibrant, living dream,

I find the beauty in the smallest things,

My soul takes flight, on eager, hopeful wings,

When I am happy, truly, deeply so,
The seeds of creativity start to grow.

When I am happy, worries lose their hold,

My heart takes flight, on an ethereal wing,
Each battle fought, each victory hard-won.
The air is sweet, a fragrant, gentle breeze,
That whispers secrets through the rustling trees.
I feel connected, wonderfully at ease,
My spirit soaring, finding inner peace.
Each moment lived, a treasure to behold,
A precious gem, a story to unfold.
The future bright, no longer dark and cold,
But filled with promise, brave and strong and bold.
When I am happy, truly, deeply free,
The world becomes a symphony for me.

When I am happy, colors seem to play,

I view the world through an enchanted day,

The sunbeams dance upon my kitchen floor,
Each dust motes glinting, tiny stars of light.
And from my heart, I open up the door,
To welcome in the beauty of the night.
No longer bound by shadows of the past,
My spirit soars, untethered and so free.
This feeling, pure and wonderful, will last,

When I am happy, truly, deeply bright,

When I am happy, time itself stands still,

I feel the earth beneath my eager will,

The air I breathe is crisp and sweet and clean,
As if a magic spell has been cast near.
And every sight, a captivating scene,
Dispelling every doubt, erasing fear.
The smallest things bring forth a pure delight,
A child's soft laughter, or a gentle sigh.
My soul is bathed in an ethereal light,
Beneath a vast and never-ending sky.
When I am happy, truly, deeply blessed,
My inner world is perfectly at rest.

When I am happy, silence sings to me,

My spirit soars, untethered and so free,

The world outside, a canvas bright and wide,

With every breath, a sense of inner pride,
Making my fractured spirit feel whole.
I see the beauty in the common things,
The way the light falls, or a child's soft sigh.
My heart takes flight, on eager, hopeful wings,

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'Before me stands I see,'

responses.text:
Before me stands I see,
A forest, ancient, dark, and deep,
Where secrets of the ages sleep,
And sunlight struggles to break free.
The gnarled oaks, with branches wide,
Like arms outstretched, embrace the sky,
While ferns unfurl where shadows lie,
And moss adorns each stony side.
A whisper through the rustling leaves,
A symphony of nature's breath,
Escaping from the grip of death,
A peace the weary soul receives.
No human sound, no hurried pace,
Just timeless beauty, wild and grand,
A sacred, undisturbed land,
A solace in this silent space.

Before me stands I see,
A mirror, polished, stark, and cold,
A story waiting to unfold,
Of who I am, and who I'll be.
My eyes reflect a silent plea,
A flicker of a nascent dream,
A current in a restless stream,
Uncertain, wild, yet longing to be free.
The lines of time, a subtle trace,
Of laughter shared, and tears that fell,
A secret only I can tell,
Reflected in this fragile space.
This image, fleeting, yet profound,
A moment caught, a truth laid bare,
A self I sometimes fail to bear,
Upon this hallowed, hallowed ground.

Before me stands I see,
The ocean's vast, untamed expanse,
A shimmering, hypnotic trance,
Where endless waves crash wild and free.
The horizon stretches, thin and far,
Where sky and water softly blend,
A journey with no certain end,
Beneath the glow of morning's star.
The salty air, a bracing kiss,
A promise whispered on the breeze,
Of mysteries beneath the seas,
And ancient, unfathomable bliss.
Each ripple holds a silent plea,
A timeless rhythm, strong and deep,
While secrets of the ages sleep,
Reflecting back eternity.

Before me stands I see,
A mountain, stoic, tall, and proud,
Its summit veiled within a cloud,
A challenge whispered silently.
The jagged peaks, like ancient teeth,
Against the sky, a stark relief,
Embodying a strong belief,
In power hidden underneath.
The winding path, a thread so thin,
Invites the soul to climb and strive,
To feel the spirit come alive,
And conquer doubts held deep within.
From base to crest, a silent plea,
For courage, strength, and will to dare,
To breathe the pure, untainted air,
And touch the sky, eternally.

Before me stands I see,
A city, vibrant, loud, and bright,
A thousand windows, bathed in light,
A restless, surging energy.
The towers climb, a steel embrace,
Against the ever-changing sky,
Where dreams are born, and hopes can fly,
Within this bustling, crowded space.
The hurried steps, a constant hum,
A symphony of human toil,
Upon this ever-fertile soil,
Where futures endlessly become.
Amidst the rush, a silent plea,
For connection, solace, and a pause,
To understand the hidden cause,
Of all this grand complexity.

Before me stands I see,
A canvas, blank, and pure, and white,
Awaiting strokes of dark and light,
A world of possibilities.
My brush in hand, a silent guide,
To bring to life a hidden thought,
A vision carefully wrought,
Where colors flow, and dreams reside.
The empty space, a quiet plea,
For passion, courage, and a spark,
To banish shadows, chase the dark,
And paint a new reality.
With every line, a gentle sway,
A universe begins to bloom,
Dispelling every trace of gloom,
And ushering in a brighter day.

Before me stands I see,
A child, with eyes so wide and clear,
Unburdened by a single fear,
Embracing pure simplicity.
A tiny hand, a gentle grasp,
A future waiting to unfold,
A story waiting to be told,
Escaping from time's fleeting clasp.
The innocent, unspoken plea,
For wonder, kindness, and a smile,
To linger for a little while,
And set the joyful spirit free.
Their laughter rings, a melody,
A beacon in a world of strife,
The precious gift of budding life,
A glimpse of true serenity.

Before me stands I see,
A book, with pages worn and old,
A thousand stories to unfold,
A journey waiting patiently.
The faded ink, a silent trace,
Of wisdom gathered through the years,
Dispelling doubts and calming fears,
Within this quiet, sacred space.
The rustling leaves, a gentle plea,
To listen closely, and to learn,
To watch the ancient lessons burn,
And set the curious spirit free.
Each word a key, a hidden door,
To worlds unknown, and minds so vast,
A treasure that is built to last,
Forevermore, forevermore.

Before me stands I see,
A garden, lush and overgrown,
Where seeds of beauty have been sown,
And wildness thrives instinctively.
The vibrant blooms, a silent cheer,
A tapestry of scent and hue,
Reflecting skies of brightest blue,
Dispelling every trace of fear.
The buzzing bees, a gentle plea,
For harmony and gentle care,
To breathe the sweet, perfumed air,
And live in pure tranquility.
Each petal soft, each leaf so green,
A testament to nature's grace,
A peaceful, undisturbed space,
A tranquil, verdant, living scene.

Before me stands I see,
A path, untrodden, winding, steep,
Where ancient secrets softly sleep,
And beckon me to follow free.
The dappled light, a silent guide,
Through tangled roots and whispered lore,
To places I have not before,
Allowed my eager steps to glide.
The rustling leaves, a gentle plea,
For courage, faith, and open mind,
To leave the known and safe behind,
And trust in what is yet to be.
Each turn a chance, a fresh embrace,
A journey into the great unknown,
Where seeds of destiny are sown,
And wonders find their rightful place.

Before me stands I see,
A ruined castle, stark and grand,
A ghost of history at hand,
Whispering tales of what used to be.
The crumbling walls, a silent plea,
For memory, and for respect,
For lives that time could not protect,
From fate's relentless decree.
The empty halls, a chilling breeze,
Echoes of laughter, battles fought,
Lessons learned, and dearly bought,
Amongst the ancient, wind-swept trees.
Each stone a story, strong and deep,
Of power lost, and empires felled,
A saga powerfully spelled,
Where secrets of the ages sleep.

Before me stands I see,
A campfire, flickering, warm, and bright,
A beacon in the darkest night,
Inviting me to simply be.
The dancing flames, a silent plea,
For stories shared, and gentle rest,
A haven for the weary guest,
From burdens that relentlessly.
The crackling wood, a soft refrain,
A rhythm ancient, wild, and free,
Reflecting true serenity,
Dispelling every trace of pain.
Around its glow, connections bloom,
As shadows lengthen, soft and deep,
While silent, precious memories keep,
Away the encroaching, chilling gloom.

Before me stands I see,
A bridge, spanning a chasm wide,
A silent promise to provide,
A passage to eternity.
The solid arch, a silent plea,
For trust, and faith, and strength of will,
To cross the void, and conquer still,
The fears that grip relentlessly.
The rushing water, far below,
A metaphor for time's swift flow,
Where currents endlessly do go,
And ancient rivers softly flow.
Each step a choice, a gentle sway,
Towards a future yet unknown,
Where seeds of hope are softly sown,
And dawn will break a brighter day.

Before me stands I see,
A mirror, not of glass, but soul,
A reflection making me whole,
And setting my true spirit free.
The lines of wisdom, etched so deep,
Upon the face I recognize,
Reflecting back through knowing eyes,
The promises I've vowed to keep.
The inner self, a silent plea,
For acceptance, kindness, and grace,
To find my true and rightful place,
In this vast, complex tapestry.
This image, fleeting, yet profound,
A moment caught, a truth laid bare,
A self I sometimes fail to bear,
Upon this hallowed, hallowed ground.

Before me stands I see,
A window, framed against the sky,
Where clouds like silent ships sail by,
And freedom beckons, wild and free.
The distant view, a silent plea,
For journeys taken, paths untrod,
A whisper from the hand of God,
To seek what's yet to come for me.
The morning light, a gentle gleam,
Upon the pane, a soft embrace,
Illuminating time and space,
A living, breathing, waking dream.
Beyond the glass, a world so vast,
Invites the soul to soar and roam,
To leave behind the earthly home,
And let the joyful moments last.

Before me stands I see,
A solitary, ancient tree,
Its branches reaching, wild and free,
A symbol of eternity.
The gnarled trunk, a silent plea,
For strength, resilience, and grace,
To hold its ground in time and space,
Against the wind's relentless decree.
The rustling leaves, a soft refrain,
A melody of life and breath,
Escaping from the grip of death,
Dispelling every trace of pain.
Its roots run deep, a hidden power,
Connecting earth to skies above,
A testament to endless love,
In every single, passing hour.

Before me stands I see,
A silhouette against the light,
A form both fragile and so bright,
A vision waiting patiently.
The contours soft, a silent plea,
For understanding, and for touch,
For loving whispers, oh so much,
From burdens that relentlessly.
The gentle sway, a soft embrace,
A rhythm ancient, wild, and free,
Reflecting true serenity,
Within this quiet, sacred space.
Unveiling slow, a hidden truth,
A gentle spirit, strong and deep,
While precious, ancient secrets keep,
Away the fleeting, fading youth.

Before me stands I see,
A field of wildflowers, bright and bold,
A thousand stories to unfold,
For all the wandering eyes to see.
The vibrant hues, a silent plea,
For beauty, wonder, and delight,
Illuminating darkest night,
And setting every spirit free.
The buzzing bees, a soft refrain,
A symphony of life and breath,
Escaping from the grip of death,
Dispelling every trace of pain.
Each fragile bloom, a gentle sway,
A testament to nature's grace,
A peaceful, undisturbed space,
A tranquil, verdant, living day.

Before me stands I see,
A clock, with hands that slowly turn,
A lesson waiting me to learn,
Of time's relentless destiny.
The ticking sound, a silent plea,
For moments cherished, held so dear,
Dispelling every trace of fear,
And setting precious spirits free.
The numbers etched, a soft embrace,
A rhythm ancient, strong, and deep,
While silent, precious memories keep,
Within this fleeting, temporal space.
Each second gone, a gentle sigh,
A testament to what has been,
A future waiting to begin,
Beneath the ever-watching eye.

Before me stands I see,
My future, shrouded, vast, and wide,
A journey where new dreams reside,
A world of pure possibility.
The unknown path, a silent plea,
For courage, wisdom, and a guide,
To face the challenges inside,
And conquer fears that cling to me.
The distant light, a gentle gleam,
Upon the horizon, soft and bright,
Illuminating darkest night,
A living, breathing, waking dream.
Each step a choice, a gentle sway,
Towards a destiny unknown,
Where seeds of hope are softly sown,
And dawn will break a brighter day.

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'One dark, dark night--it was long ago,'

responses.text:
One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
The wind a whisper, soft and low.
The moon, a sliver, hid its face,
Leaving shadows in its place.
No stars dared pierce the velvet sky,
Only ancient secrets passing by.
A lone wolf howled, a mournful sound,
As ancient spirits walked the ground.
The old oak groaned, its branches bare,
A silent witness to despair.
What happened then, in that deep gloom?
Perhaps a promise, or a tomb.
A memory etched in time's embrace,
A forgotten tale, without a trace.
But still the echo lingers near,
A ghost of feeling, held so dear.
That dark, dark night, a whispered plea,
Lives on within the heart of me.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When tales of old began to flow.
The fire crackled, warm and bright,
Chasing shadows from the night.
Grandfather's voice, a gentle hum,
Spoke of wonders yet to come.
Or horrors past, in distant lands,
Held captive in his weathered hands.
The children huddled, eyes so wide,
As ancient mysteries inside
Their youthful minds began to bloom,
Dispelling every hint of gloom.
That dark, dark night, a sacred space,
Where stories found their rightful place.
A tapestry of myth and lore,
Unfurling on the cottage floor.
And though the years have passed away,
That night remains, as clear as day.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When sorrow's bitter seeds did sow.
The rain fell heavy, cold and stark,
Each drop a tear within the dark.
A lonely figure, cloaked in dread,
Walked pathways where the fallen tread.
No light to guide, no hand to hold,
A story silently unfolds.
Of broken vows and whispered lies,
Reflected in despairing eyes.
The heart, a vessel, filled with pain,
Endured the storm, the endless rain.
That dark, dark night, a turning point,
When fate's cruel arrow did anoint
A soul with burdens, heavy, deep,
Secrets the silent shadows keep.
And though the dawn eventually broke,
The memory forever spoke.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When magic stirred and spirits glowed.
The ancient woods, a silent maze,
Absorbed the moon's elusive haze.
A hidden path, by moss concealed,
A world of wonder was revealed.
The fae folk danced on dewy grass,
As time itself began to pass
In shimmering hues of emerald light,
A breathtaking, ethereal sight.
The air was thick with whispered spells,
And echoes from forgotten wells.
That dark, dark night, a sacred space,
Where dreams found form and beauty's grace.
A fleeting glimpse of realms unseen,
A memory, vibrant and serene.
And though the waking world returned,
The magic in my heart still burned.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When youthful dreams began to grow.
Beneath the cloak of deepest black,
No fear could hold our spirits back.
With whispered plans and hopeful hearts,
We played our brave and daring parts.
Exploring shadows, vast and deep,
While weary grown-ups lay asleep.
The thrill of mischief, sweet and low,
A secret only we would know.
The world felt boundless, free, and wide,
With every star our faithful guide.
That dark, dark night, a joyful quest,
A childhood memory, truly blessed.
Of laughter shared and bonds so strong,
Where innocence could not go wrong.
Though years have passed, the feeling stays,
Those cherished, unforgettable days.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When silent rivers ceased to flow.
The world held still, a breathless pause,
Defying nature's ancient laws.
No rustling leaf, no distant sound,
Just eerie quiet all around.
The air hung heavy, thick and cold,
A story waiting to unfold.
Perhaps a comet, bright and vast,
Across the heavens swiftly passed.
Or ancient beings, from afar,
Observed us from a distant star.
That dark, dark night, a mystery,
Etched in the fabric of history.
A moment frozen, strange and deep,
Secrets the universe will keep.
And though the sun returned at dawn,
The quiet lingers, never gone.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When fear itself began to grow.
The shadows danced with monstrous glee,
Reflecting what we feared to see.
Each creaking branch, a phantom's sigh,
A chilling whisper passing by.
The house stood silent, gaunt and tall,
Awaiting footsteps in the hall.
Our young hearts pounded, fast and wild,
As terror gripped each anxious child.
Imagination, unrestrained,
By every eerie sound was trained.
That dark, dark night, a test of will,
To conquer fears and stand quite still.
Though logic tells us it was naught,
The memory's lessons still are taught.
Of courage found in darkest hours,
And overcoming unseen powers.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When whispers started, soft and low.
Of ancient curses, deep and grim,
That haunted every shadowed limb
Of gnarled old trees and crumbling walls,
Responding to the raven's calls.
The villagers, with worried eyes,
Looked to the dark and moonless skies.
They spoke of specters, pale and thin,
Who sought to lure lost souls within.
The air grew heavy, thick with dread,
As tales of vengeance filled each head.
That dark, dark night, a chilling fear,
Drew every trembling heart so near.
To legends passed from sire to son,
Until the morning light had won.
But still the echo, faint and cold,
A story whispered, never old.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When love's first tender seeds did sow.
Beneath a sky of inky hue,
My hand found yours, so warm and true.
The world outside could fade away,
Lost in the magic of that day.
Or rather, night, a sacred time,
When hearts aligned in perfect rhyme.
No need for words, a silent plea,
To share a future, just with me.
The air was charged, a sweet delight,
As passion bloomed in darkest night.
That dark, dark night, a precious start,
Engraved forever in my heart.
A memory cherished, pure and deep,
Secrets that only true love keeps.
And though the years have flown so fast,
The essence of that night will last.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When secrets started to bestow
Their heavy burden, cold and grim,
Upon a soul, from limb to limb.
A whispered promise, quickly made,
A truth concealed, a trust betrayed.
The silent witness, just the moon,
That vanished all too, all too soon.
The weight of silence, hard to bear,
A hidden sorrow, beyond compare.
No comfort found, no gentle hand,
Just solitude in barren land.
That dark, dark night, a fateful choice,
Silenced a heart, subdued a voice.
A path diverging, stark and deep,
Secrets that time itself would keep.
And though the sun may rise anew,
The shadow lingers, dark and true.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When inspiration's fount did flow.
The pen moved swiftly, on the page,
Unleashing fury, love, and rage.
The words took form, a vibrant stream,
Awakening a waking dream.
The world outside, a distant hum,
As thoughts and feelings overcame
The quiet stillness of the room,
Dispelling every hint of gloom.
A story born, a verse complete,
So wonderfully, divinely sweet.
That dark, dark night, a creative fire,
Fueled by an unquenchable desire.
To capture beauty, truth, and pain,
And let imagination reign.
And though the ink has long since dried,
The spirit of that night still rides.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When chilling prophecies did grow.
The ancient oracle, old and blind,
Unveiled the future of mankind.
Her voice, a rasp, a ghostly sound,
As dire warnings filled the ground.
Of coming shadows, vast and deep,
And promises the Fates would keep.
The listeners trembled, filled with dread,
As cosmic truths were softly said.
Of cycles ending, new ones born,
A world reshaped, by dawn to morn.
That dark, dark night, a revelation,
Igniting fear and contemplation.
Of destinies, both grand and grim,
Whispered from time's remotest rim.
And though the years have sped along,
The prophecy remains, so strong.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When constellations started to show
Their brilliant patterns, bright and clear,
Dispelling every earthly fear.
We lay upon the dewy ground,
Without a single human sound.
Just whispered awe, and silent sighs,
Reflecting wonders in our eyes.
The Milky Way, a silver stream,
A cosmic, captivating dream.
Each tiny star, a distant sun,
Its journey through the ages run.
That dark, dark night, a grand display,
Of nature's majesty, holding sway.
A humbling vision, vast and deep,
Secrets the universe would keep.
And though the city lights now gleam,
That starlit night remains a dream.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When bitter winds began to blow.
The snow fell heavy, soft and deep,
While all the weary world did sleep.
The fire dwindled, low and slow,
A flickering, uncertain glow.
Outside, the tempest raged and roared,
As winter's fury was outpoured.
We huddled close, a tiny band,
Alone within a frozen land.
Our breath, like mist, escaped our lips,
As coldness claimed our fingertips.
That dark, dark night, a struggle stark,
To find a flicker in the dark.
Of hope and warmth, a simple plea,
To conquer winter's tyranny.
And though the spring eventually came,
The memory still calls its name.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When ancient rituals did flow.
The standing stones, in silent grace,
Observed the moon's ethereal face.
The druids chanted, soft and low,
As mystic energies did grow.
The air was thick with sacred might,
Connecting day to darkest night.
Offerings made, with reverence deep,
Secrets the hallowed earth would keep.
To honor spirits, old and wise,
Reflected in their knowing eyes.
That dark, dark night, a primal scene,
Where veil between worlds was so thin.
A powerful, forgotten art,
Engraved upon the land's own heart.
And though the ages have since passed,
The echoes of that night still last.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When silent tears began to flow.
A loss so heavy, sharp and keen,
Left nothing but an empty scene.
The world felt hollow, cold, and vast,
As cherished memories held fast.
A final breath, a whispered name,
Extinguished life's eternal flame.
No words could ease the crushing pain,
As grief poured down like endless rain.
The heart, a vessel, cracked and sore,
Longing for what was no more.
That dark, dark night, a poignant truth,
Of fleeting life and tender youth.
A farewell whispered, soft and low,
Where deepest sorrows start to grow.
And though the healing slowly came,
The memory still speaks its name.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When restless spirits started to show.
Through ancient halls, they softly glide,
With untold stories held inside.
The air grew chill, a sudden breeze,
Rustling through the dormant trees.
A phantom scent, a distant sound,
As spectral figures walked the ground.
Their mournful whispers, faint and low,
Of lives lived out, so long ago.
Bound to this place, by fate's decree,
Forever restless, never free.
That dark, dark night, a haunting sight,
Illuminated by no light.
A glimpse beyond the mortal veil,
A whispered, melancholy wail.
And though the morning broke anew,
The presence lingers, dark and true.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When ships set sail, and winds did blow.
Across the waves, to distant shores,
Exploring hidden, unknown doors.
The compass spun, a guiding friend,
Until the journey's destined end.
The stars, their only constant light,
Through endless hours of darkest night.
With hopeful hearts and spirits bold,
A brave new future to unfold.
Against the ocean's vast expanse,
A daring, perilous romance.
That dark, dark night, a voyage grand,
To reach a promised, foreign land.
A testament to human might,
To seek the dawn through darkest night.
And though the maps are drawn and clear,
The spirit of that night is here.

One dark, dark night--it was long ago,
When seeds of change began to sow.
The old ways crumbled, slow and deep,
While new ideas started to creep.
Into the minds of weary folk,
Awakening from slumber's yoke.
A quiet revolution's birth,

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'We have met before'

responses.text:
"We have met before," a whisper in the breeze,
A flicker in the mind, a memory to seize.
Across the eons, through the dust of time,
Your eyes, a familiar echo, a forgotten rhyme.
Was it in a dream, where shadows softly played,
Or in a life long past, a promise gently made?
The scent of ancient earth, the taste of sunlit rain,
A recognition stirring, easing silent pain.
My soul remembers yours, a bond unseen, untold,
A story etched in starlight, brave and ever bold.
This feeling, deep and true, transcends the fleeting now,
A sacred, timeless meeting, beneath an ancient bough.
So let the present bloom, with roots in what has been,
Two kindred spirits finding, where they once convened."

"We have met before," the words hung in the air,
A silent recognition, beyond all worldly care.
Perhaps in childhood games, beneath a willow's sweep,
Or in a shared despair, where secrets we would keep.
Your laughter, like a melody, I'd heard in distant lands,
Your touch, a gentle comfort, from long-forgotten hands.
The universe conspires, in ways we can't foresee,
To bring us back together, for eternity.
This sense of deja vu, a cosmic, tender sign,
That destinies entwine, across the great design.
No stranger are you now, but kin from journeys past,
A bond that time cannot diminish, nor shadows overcast.
So let us weave new tales, on threads of what we know,
And watch our present story, beautifully grow."

"We have met before," a quiet, knowing glance,
In this crowded room, a serendipitous dance.
Is it the curve of your smile, the cadence of your voice,
That stirs a distant feeling, leaving me no choice
But to believe in echoes, in lives that intertwine,
In cosmic threads that bind us, a sacred, grand design?
Perhaps in a library, among forgotten lore,
Or by a stormy ocean, on a wild, windswept shore.
The feeling is profound, a comfort to my soul,
Like finding a lost piece, that makes my spirit whole.
No need for introductions, no need for feigned surprise,
Just the silent understanding, reflected in your eyes.
So let this moment linger, a bridge to what has been,
A gentle, sweet reunion, where our paths convene."

"We have met before," a whisper from the deep,
From slumbering memories, that secrets keep.
Was it beneath a crescent moon, on sands of ancient gold,
Or in a warrior's camp, a story to be told?
The resonance is startling, a tremor in my core,
As if my very being has known you long before.
Your spirit calls to mine, a beacon in the night,
Igniting sparks of knowing, with an ethereal light.
This recognition feels like coming home, after a long, long roam,
A truth etched in the cosmos, within a starlit dome.
So let us trace the patterns, of where our souls have been,
And revel in this moment, where our paths convene again.
No longer strangers, but echoes from the past,
A bond eternally woven, meant forever to last."

"We have met before," the words escape my lips,
A phantom touch, a fleeting, soft eclipse.
In sun-drenched fields of summer, or winter's frosted gleam,
Your presence feels familiar, like a half-forgotten dream.
Is it the way you carry joy, or navigate despair,
That speaks to something ancient, a burden we might share?
The air around you hums, with an old, familiar tune,
Beneath a timeless sky, or a silver, mystic moon.
My heart beats a rhythm, I recognize as old,
A story often whispered, but never fully told.
This meeting is no accident, no random twist of fate,
But a destined convergence, before it is too late.
So let us share the present, with wisdom from the past,
And build a future solid, a love meant to last."

"We have met before," a certainty so strong,
As if my very spirit has known you all along.
Perhaps in silent battles, or triumphs, bold and bright,
Or sharing whispered secrets, beneath the fading light.
Your energy, a beacon, I've followed through the years,
Through laughter and through sorrow, through triumphs and through tears.
This isn't just a feeling, but a deep, intrinsic knowing,
A river of connection, eternally flowing.
My soul remembers journeys, where our paths once ran as one,
Beneath a different sky, beneath a distant sun.
So let us not deny this, this truth that gently gleams,
But embrace the sacred echo, woven into dreams.
And build upon this foundation, ancient and so pure,
A bond that will forever, patiently endure."

"We have met before," a phrase that softly sighs,
Reflected in the depths of your enigmatic eyes.
Was it in a crowded market, where spices filled the air,
Or in a quiet garden, beyond all earthly care?
The feeling is persistent, a gentle, knowing hum,
That through the veil of ages, our spirits have become
Acquainted with each other, in ways we can't explain,
Like raindrops finding rivers, through sunshine and through rain.
My inner compass points to you, a truth I can't deny,
Beneath the vast expanse of a never-ending sky.
This meeting is a tapestry, of moments long since past,
A beautiful unraveling, a bond that's meant to last.
So let us honor this, this silent, sacred plea,
And let our present story, beautifully be."

"We have met before," a whisper on the breeze,
As if the very cosmos conspired to put us at ease.
Perhaps in ancient forests, where secrets softly slept,
Or by a hidden fountain, where silent promises were kept.
Your essence feels familiar, a comfort to my soul,
Making broken pieces mend, making my spirit whole.
This isn't mere coincidence, but destiny's design,
A sacred, timeless merging, eternally divine.
My spirit recognizes yours, a language understood,
From realms beyond the present, for the greater good.
So let this recognition, bloom into a gentle grace,
And find a cherished haven, in this time and space.
No longer strangers wandering, but souls forever bound,
On consecrated pathways, where true love can be found."

"We have met before," the words, a gentle chime,
Echoing through the corridors of space and time.
Was it in a bustling city, a fleeting, hurried glance,
Or in a moonlit meadow, a tender, silent dance?
The sense of deep connection, a bond both old and new,
As if my very being has always known of you.
Your laughter, like a melody, a song I've heard before,
Opening ancient doorways, to an unseen, distant shore.
My heart feels a stirring, a memory revived,
Of countless past encounters, beautifully contrived.
This meeting is a testament, to journeys long and far,
Guided by a single, unwavering, guiding star.
So let us walk this pathway, with spirits intertwined,
Leaving all the shadows, and doubts behind."

"We have met before," a truth that softly gleams,
Reflected in the mirror of forgotten dreams.
Perhaps in a sun-drenched vineyard, beneath a summer sky,
Or in a quiet moment, as tearful goodbyes fly.
The familiarity is striking, a comfort to my heart,
As if we played a crucial, ancient, cosmic part.
Your wisdom, like a beacon, I've followed through the years,
Dispelling all the shadows, and calming all my fears.
My soul remembers journeys, where our paths once ran as one,
Before the dawn of ages, before the rising sun.
This isn't just a feeling, but a deep, intrinsic knowing,
A river of connection, eternally flowing.
So let us not deny this, this truth that gently gleams,
But embrace the sacred echo, woven into dreams."

"We have met before," a whisper, soft and low,

Your presence feels like home, a solace to my soul,
Making scattered fragments mend, making my spirit whole.
This isn't mere coincidence, but destiny's embrace,
Bringing us together, in this time and space.

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'I saw an old cottage of clay,'

responses.text:
I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where time had worn the years away.
Its thatched roof, a tattered crown,
Watched silent as the sun went down.
No smoke rose from its chimney tall,
Just shadows dancing on the wall.
The window panes, like vacant eyes,
Reflected ever-changing skies.
A garden overgrown and wild,
Where nature's gentle hand had smiled
Upon forgotten rose and weed,
A testament to life's slow seed.
I wondered who had lived inside,
What hopes and dreams had there resided.
A whisper of a bygone age,
Turned slowly, like a fading page.
And though it stood in quiet decay,
Its humble beauty held its sway.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Bathed in the soft light of the day.
The wattle and daub, a rustic hue,
Whispered tales of old, and new.
A crooked door, ajar a space,
Invited me to glimpse its grace.
Inside, a hearth, now cold and gray,
Where laughter once had held its sway.
The air was thick with memory's scent,
Of lives within its walls content.
Perhaps a weaver, nimble-handed,
Or farmer, by the fields commanded.
Each crack and crevice, deeply etched,
A silent history, finely sketched.
It stood a relic, strong and deep,
A thousand secrets it did keep.
And though its glory had declined,
Its spirit lingered, intertwined.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where ivy clung in green array.
The moss grew thick upon its stones,
A symphony of quiet moans
From timbers groaning, old and worn,
Since first its humble form was born.
No human voice, no dog's soft bark,
Just silence echoing in the dark.
A sense of peace, profoundly deep,
Where ancient spirits seemed to sleep.
The path overgrown, a winding thread,
To lives long past, and words unsaid.
I felt a kinship with its plight,
Enduring through the fading light.
A monument to simple toil,
Rooted deep in native soil.
And in its stillness, I could find,
A beauty of a different kind.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Beneath a sky of muted gray.
Its walls, a canvas, soft and worn,
By sun and wind, and winter's storm.
A single flower, bravely bright,
Peered from a crack, a hopeful sight.
The garden gate, unhinged and low,
Invited whispers, soft and slow.
I pictured children, small and fleet,
With dusty, quickly moving feet.
Their laughter ringing, clear and free,
Beneath a long-forgotten tree.
Now only echoes filled the air,
A poignant silence, everywhere.
This humble dwelling, standing fast,
A memory of futures past.
And in its quiet, I could glean,
The beauty of what once had been.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where shadows stretched at close of day.
Its roofline sagged, a weary sigh,
Beneath the vast and open sky.
The chimney breast, a sturdy square,
Once breathed out warmth into the air.
Now empty, cold, a silent friend,
Until its slow and certain end.
I wondered if a poet dreamed,
Or simple folk, whose lives had gleamed
Within its shelter, safe and sound,
Upon that consecrated ground.
A sense of history, rich and deep,
Secrets the silent walls did keep.
And as I watched the twilight fade,
A lasting impression it had made.
This humble dwelling, worn and old,
A story waiting to unfold.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where dreams had bloomed and then decayed.
The window boxes, now quite bare,
Once held geraniums, sweet and fair.
Imagined voices, soft and low,
From days of long and long ago.
A woman humming, soft and sweet,
Upon a worn and wooden seat.
A child's small hand, a curious gaze,
Through sunlit, long-forgotten days.
The very air seemed thick with lore,
Of lives lived on that earthen floor.
It stood a testament to time,
To human struggle, quite sublime.
And though its purpose now was done,
Its quiet dignity had won
My heart, with tales it couldn't tell,
Beneath its ancient, silent spell.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where sunbeams danced and would not stay.
Its walls absorbed the golden light,
Then held it through the coming night.
A sense of warmth, though long since gone,
Still lingered, with the rising dawn.
Perhaps a craftsman, skilled and true,
Had built this home, for me and you
To ponder on, its simple grace,
Reflecting time, in this quiet place.
Each imperfection, deeply set,
A memory I can't forget.
It spoke of patience, slow and deep,
Of promises the earth did keep.
And as I walked its silent ground,
A profound peace was to be found.
This humble dwelling, worn and old,
A story waiting to unfold.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where autumn leaves began to play.
They swirled and danced around its base,
A final flourish, full of grace.
The wooden door, ajar a bit,
Revealed the shadows that within it sit.
A ghostly hearth, where embers died,
And silent whispers now reside.
I felt a presence, faint and clear,
Of those who once had lingered here.
Their hopes and fears, their joy and pain,
Absorbed by sun, and wind, and rain.
It stood a sentinel, stark and lone,
Upon its ancient, earthly throne.
And in its quiet, I could trace,
The beauty of a bygone space.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Upon a hill, not far away.
Its humble form, a gentle curve,
Against the sky, it held its nerve.
The garden fence, now broken down,
No longer guarded field or town.
But still, a spirit seemed to cling,
To every weathered, ancient thing.
Of simple lives, of honest toil,
Rooted deep within the soil.
Of hands that shaped the very earth,
To bring this dwelling into birth.
And though its purpose now was done,
Its quiet dignity had won
My heart, with tales it couldn't tell,
Beneath its ancient, silent spell.

I wondered who had lived inside,
What hopes and dreams had there resided.
A whisper of a bygone age,
Turned slowly, like a fading page.
And though it stood in quiet decay,
Its humble beauty held its sway.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Bathed in the soft light of the day.
The wattle and daub, a rustic hue,
Whispered tales of old, and new.
A crooked door, ajar a space,
Invited me to glimpse its grace.
Inside, a hearth, now cold and gray,
Where laughter once had held its sway.
The air was thick with memory's scent,
Of lives within its walls content.
Perhaps a weaver, nimble-handed,
Or farmer, by the fields commanded.
Each crack and crevice, deeply etched,
A silent history, finely sketched.
It stood a relic, strong and deep,
A thousand secrets it did keep.
And though its glory had declined,
Its spirit lingered, intertwined.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where ivy clung in green array.
The moss grew thick upon its stones,
A symphony of quiet moans
From timbers groaning, old and worn,
Since first its humble form was born.
No human voice, no dog's soft bark,
Just silence echoing in the dark.
A sense of peace, profoundly deep,
Where ancient spirits seemed to sleep.
The path overgrown, a winding thread,
To lives long past, and words unsaid.
I felt a kinship with its plight,
Enduring through the fading light.
A monument to simple toil,
Rooted deep in native soil.
And in its stillness, I could find,
A beauty of a different kind.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Beneath a sky of muted gray.
Its walls, a canvas, soft and worn,
By sun and wind, and winter's storm.
A single flower, bravely bright,
Peered from a crack, a hopeful sight.
The garden gate, unhinged and low,
Invited whispers, soft and slow.
I pictured children, small and fleet,
With dusty, quickly moving feet.
Their laughter ringing, clear and free,
Beneath a long-forgotten tree.
Now only echoes filled the air,
A poignant silence, everywhere.
This humble dwelling, standing fast,
A memory of futures past.
And in its quiet, I could glean,
The beauty of what once had been.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where shadows stretched at close of day.
Its roofline sagged, a weary sigh,
Beneath the vast and open sky.
The chimney breast, a sturdy square,
Once breathed out warmth into the air.
Now empty, cold, a silent friend,
Until its slow and certain end.
I wondered if a poet dreamed,
Or simple folk, whose lives had gleamed
Within its shelter, safe and sound,
Upon that consecrated ground.
A sense of history, rich and deep,
Secrets the silent walls did keep.
And as I watched the twilight fade,
A lasting impression it had made.
This humble dwelling, worn and old,
A story waiting to unfold.

I saw an old cottage of clay,
Where dreams had bloomed and then decayed.
The window boxes, now quite bare,
Once held geraniums, sweet and fair.
Imagined voices, soft and low,
From days of long and long ago.
A woman humming, soft and sweet,
Upon a worn and wooden seat.
A child's small hand, a curious gaze,
Through sunlit, long-forgotten days.
The very air seemed thick with lore,
Of lives lived on that earthen floor.
It stood a testament to time,
To human struggle, quite sublime.
And though its purpose now was done,
Its quiet dignity had won
My heart, with tales it couldn't tell,
Beneath its ancient, silent spell.

Where life's resilient spirit, asks for more.
So let the weather shift, or calmly stay the same,

Will dust storms swirl, a veil across the land,

The children play their games, with laughter pure and free,

Each cooling breeze, a gesture of its love.

So let the heavens rage, or softly, gently gleam,
Kabul's enduring spirit, like a timeless dream.

prompt: Please write a poem inspired by the line: 'Loss can be good for us,'

responses.text:
Loss can be good for us, a bitter pill to swallow whole,
But in its wake, a space unfolds, for growth within the soul.
The old must fall, the leaves must fade, for spring to reappear,
And in the quiet, empty glade, new shoots dispel the fear.
A comfort gone, a path erased, a future unforeseen,
Yet in that void, a strength is traced, a bolder, sharper sheen.
We learn to stand, to find our feet, when props are pulled away,
And face the dawn, however sweet, a brighter, brand new day.
So let the tears, if they must flow, cleanse pathways to the new,
For even in the deepest woe, some hidden truth shines through.
A lesson learned, a spirit forged, a wisdom deeply sown,
From what was lost, a self emerged, more resilient, and full-grown.

Loss can be good for us, a whisper in the dark,
When cherished things turn into dust, and leave their fading mark.
It strips away the superficial, the comfort and the ease,
And forces us to look internal, to face our deepest pleas.
The branches break, the fruit may fall, but roots go deeper still,
And from the wreckage, standing tall, we find a stronger will.
No longer bound by what was known, a different path we seek,
A seed of courage, newly sown, where once the spirit was weak.
Though sorrow's grip may hold us fast, and shadows may descend,
This bitter truth, designed to last, helps broken spirits mend.
For in the absence, clarity, a vision sharp and keen,
To build anew, with honesty, upon a vibrant, fertile scene.

Loss can be good for us, a sculptor's harsh demand,
To chip away the superfluous, with an unyielding hand.
The marble rough, the form concealed, until the pieces fly,
And what was hidden is revealed, beneath a watchful eye.
A friendship ends, a dream takes flight, a chapter closes tight,
And in the ensuing, silent night, we learn to find our light.
No longer leaning on the past, a future we embrace,
With lessons learned, designed to last, etched on a wiser face.
The pain may sting, the heart may ache, a heavy, somber weight,
But from the ruins, we awake, to navigate our fate.
For in the letting go, we find, a freedom to begin,
To leave the old, the worn behind, and let new strengths within.

Loss can be good for us, though reason may resist,
It clears the way for something new, a future to exist.
The comfortable, familiar grip, can hold us to the ground,
Until a sudden, jarring slip, where new perspectives are found.
A job is gone, a love departs, a vision starts to fade,
And in the breaking of our hearts, a stronger soul is made.
We search within, for inner worth, when outer props are gone,
And plant new seeds upon the earth, to greet a rising dawn.
The tears may flow, a heavy rain, but nourish fertile soil,
And from the sorrow, from the pain, a richer life we coil.
For in the void, a space is made, for strength to truly bloom,
No longer lost, no longer afraid, emerging from the gloom.

Loss can be good for us, a fire that refines,
Burning off the dross and rust, revealing truer lines.
The silver gleams, the gold shines bright, when purged by fervent heat,
And in the darkness of the night, new wisdom we can meet.
A habit broken, a belief undone, a comfort set aside,
And in the setting of the sun, new pathways open wide.
We learn to cope, to stand alone, when others disappear,
And find a power, truly known, dispelling every fear.
The wounds may smart, the scars remain, but tell a story deep,
Of battles fought, of lessons gained, secrets the heart will keep.
For in the stripping bare, we find, a truer, stronger core,
A resilient spirit, finely twined, ready to explore.

Loss can be good for us, a bitter, cleansing tide,
To wash away the dust and fuss, where hidden truths reside.
The currents strong, the waters deep, they pull us from the shore,
And secrets that our spirits keep, are opened to explore.
A dream dissolved, a hope laid low, a future rearranged,
And in the falling of the snow, the landscape is exchanged.
We learn to build, with different tools, when old ones are no more,
And break free from familiar rules, to open every door.
The grief may linger, cold and stark, a shadow on the way,
But in the darkness, leaves its mark, for a brighter, coming day.
For in the emptiness, we see, a chance to start anew,
To find a deeper liberty, and follow what is true.

The branches pruned, the garden cleared, for richer growth to bloom,

responses.text:

The subtle plotting, heedless of the fall

A different justice, on a different road.
This is the whisper, ere the curtain lifts,

So listen closely, to the gathering sound,

Their escapades sealed by the hand of fate.

A world of cunning, in a schoolboy's world.

Where logic bends, and rules are set aside.

This prelude played, upon a youthful heart.

Where rules are challenged, right from the very start.

The school's old clock, with its deliberate chime,

The dormitory's gleam, the classroom's quiet drone,
